title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text:
In the UK in the period January to June (H1) 2025:

Box office revenue was £496 million, up 18% on H1 2024 and down 17% on H1 2019.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text:
There were 61 million cinema admissions, 12% higher than in H1 2024 and 27% lower than in H1 2019.
Figures are for all films on release, including event releases and those that started their release prior to the H1 period.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text:
April recorded 2025’s highest monthly admissions to date, at 11.8 million.
A Minecraft Movie, 2025’s top-earning film so far, was released in the first week of April.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text:
At the UK and Republic of Ireland (ROI) box office:

Revenue for films released in H1 2025 was £467.8 million, up 14% on H1 2024 and down 20% on H1 2019.
This excludes event releases.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text:
The total market share of all UK qualifying films was just shy of 45%, almost 20 percentage points higher than H1 2024’s UK qualifying share (26%).
(2025 figures in chart sum to 44% due to rounding.)

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text:
In the UK, in the 12 months to June 2025:

The combined total spend on film and high-end television (HETV) production was £5.7 billion.
This graph shows ‘first reported’ figures for production spend.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text:
Production data is revised every quarter to account for lags in obtaining complete data across all types of productions.
Combined spend for the 12 months to June 2025 was up 18% on revised figures for the previous 12-month period.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text: HETV accounted for 64% of UK production spend in the 12 months to June 2025.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text: UK spend on film production was £2.1 billion, up 18% compared with revised figures for the 12 months ending June 2024.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text:
The BFI assigns productions to one of three categories:

Inward investment features (INW)
Domestic UK features (DOM)
Co-productions (COP)

See notes to statistics releases for full definitions.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text: UK spend on HETV projects was £3.7 billion in the 12 months to June 2025, up 18% on revised figures for the previous 12-month period.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text: Growth was driven by an increase in spend on inward investment programmes (INW).

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text:
In the UK, in the 12 months to June 2025:

Combined production starts were up 3% on first reported figures for the 12 months to June 2024.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text: Production count for the 12 months to June 2025 is lower than for the other periods shown here. However, as previously noted, figures are likely to be revised upward in subsequent statistical releases as more data becomes available.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text: We saw earlier that HETV accounted for the majority of UK production spend in the 12 months to June 2025. Film, however, accounted for the majority of productions: 55%.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text: 196 films were recorded as starting principal photography in the UK in the 12 months to June 2025.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text: Lags in obtaining complete data on production activity tend to disproportionately affect counts for domestic UK feature films (DOM), particularly those with budgets of less than £500,000.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text: 159 HETV programmes were recorded as starting principal photography in the UK in the 12 months to June 2025.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to June 2025
text: HETV programme starts in the 12 months to June 2025 included 22 feature-length single episode productions.
